meanings.definition: Promoting or relating to unity among different Christian churches or denominations.
meanings.sent1: The ecumenical gathering brought together members of various Christian denominations.
meanings.sent2: The ecumenical council aimed to foster cooperation among different Christian churches.
meanings.sent3: At the ecumenical picnic, everyone shared food and stories from their churches.
meanings.sent4: Her ecumenical spirit was like a bridge connecting different Christian communities.
meanings.sent5: The ecumenical movement strives to create harmony among diverse Christian groups.

meanings.sent1: The ecumenical leader spoke on behalf of the global Christian community.
meanings.sent2: The ecumenical symbol on the flag represented the unity of all Christians worldwide.
meanings.sent3: In the ecumenical art exhibition, artists showcased pieces inspired by Christianity around the world.
meanings.sent4: His ecumenical vision painted a picture of a united Christian church spanning continents.
meanings.sent5: The ecumenical anthem echoed across nations, symbolizing the bond among Christians worldwide.

meanings.definition: Showing a willingness to work with people from different religious backgrounds.
meanings.sent1: Her ecumenical approach to interfaith dialogue opened doors for collaboration with diverse religious groups.
meanings.sent2: The ecumenical project aimed to build bridges between individuals of varying religious beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The ecumenical bake sale brought together volunteers from different faith traditions to support a common cause.
meanings.sent4: His ecumenical mindset was a key factor in fostering understanding among people of different religions.
meanings.sent5: The ecumenical workshop provided a platform for individuals to learn from each other's diverse spiritual practices.
